page.title: 08TOFT HALL FARM,TOFT.
page.content: THE MAYERS ARE TENANT FARMERS,PAYING RENT TO THE LEYCESTER-ROXBY ESTATE. IT IS A MIXED FARM OF 300 ACRES.THEY KEEP DAIRY CATTLE AND GROW WHEAT,BARLEY AND GRASS FOR SILAGE.CROPS ARE ROTATED YEARLY;100 ACRES OF WHEAT AND BARLEY AND 100 ACRES OF POTATOES.THE CATTLE ARE OUT ON GRASS IN SUMMER.BOTH ORGANIC AND CHEMICAL FERTILIZERS ARE USED.MOST OF THE GRAIN IS FED TO THE COWS. ONE SON HELPS,PLUS THREE OTHER MEN WHO WORK WITH COWS,TRACTORS AND DO ODD JOBS. PAPERWORK IS TIME-CONSUMING AND RECENTLY A COMPUTER HAS BEEN INSTALLED TO HELP,IT ALSO CONTROLS THE MILKING-PARLOUR MACHINERY AND RECORDS AMOUNTS OF MILK GIVEN.MILK IS SOLD TO THE MILK MARKETING BOARD. RABBITS ARE THE MAIN NUISANCE AND ARE BEING CONTROLLED BY FERRETS.
